name: Westin St. John Resort & Villas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second trip to the Westin. We love it.
reviews.title: Another Great Trip at the Westin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you arrive you have the choice of using Westin's transportation or handling it yourself. $110 per person for the Westin costs more and it has both advantages and disadvantages. It includes unlimited trips to St. Thomas, so if you want to shop or golf one day, it is worth it. If you have a very early departure out of STT, absolutely do it as they will get you a private water taxi if needed to get you there in time. On the downside, you will lose about 2 hours on your day of arrival waiting for their boat, but during that time you can shop and eat at a pretty fun bar right by where you get picked up. Doing it on your own is cheaper and faster, but you are on your own. "Taxi" service isn't a private car like at home. It is a big open pickup with seats and it costs extra if you want them to leave right when you get in. You may be made to wait for 15 minutes while the driver looks for more fares and you may not go directly to your destination.
reviews.title: Great save for our honeymoon!!!! Thank you Hannah!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are fairly clean with standard Westin heavenly beds and linens. Beachfront rooms and hillside vill as are best. It is a fairly big resort, so the farther you get from the pool the more walking you will do. Don't expect your SPG Gold status to get you much of an upgrade as Platinum SPG guests are fairly common at this resort.
reviews.title: 5-star location, 1/2-star service....

reviews.text: I read about bedbugs in other reviews and I am reasonably sure the reviewers don't know what they are talking about. The Virgin Islands have a sand flea sometimes called "no see'ums". You don't feel them bite you and the itch doesn't start for hours. It stands to reason that people who went to bed thinking they were bite free and wake up itching like crazy assume bed bugs. A light coat of insect repellent before you go out for the day or night goes a long way.
reviews.title: 6 Great Days!!!!

reviews.text: Make your own plan for breakfast, as a sit down breakfast is quite pricey and of Denny's quality. Bagels, muffins, and coffee can be had at the mini-mart for about $10 a couple.
reviews.title: Great time with family!! Awesome service!!

reviews.text: As a Starwood Vacation Owner, I was excited to take my family away from our home resort in Maui to St. John this week. Boy am I and my family upset I did.
reviews.title: Run...........don't walk away!!!!! HORRIBLE!!!!!!

reviews.text: From the minute we checked in nothing was right. From the holes in our 3 Bedroom Villa (and these are the good new rooms) to the blood stains in the carpet to housekeeping unable to clean the room, our vacation was not up to standard.
reviews.title: Already booked... good luck. Still considering... find another

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What amazes me is that this property is one of the top (if not the) locations within the Starwood Vacation Owner locations. They do not even have a general manager to handle issues only staff who try their best but cannot get anything done.
reviews.title: Great Property but Needs Updating.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was embarrassed that I brought my friends along to show off this property. Nothing and I mean nothing was good.
reviews.title: Great Service! Impeccable facility! We will be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please listen to me and do not ever go there!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Not worth the money
Nothing Special!
reviews.text: We just returned from a four-day stay at the Westin St. John and I found it to be just ordinary. If not for our last minute deal found on Hotwire, I would not pay the Westin's rack rate of nearly $400 per night. We were given an updated room near the pool in building 12 and at that location we were saved the long walks to the hillside. Except for the bed itself, the room is ordinary. The resort location is so unfortunate as it is on a man-made beach with terrible sand next to a working marina. To stay on the beach for any part of the day would be a waste of time as there are much better beach options anywhere else on the island. Based on other reviews, many found the Westin grounds to be spectacular. I was sorely disappointed in how ordinary their grounds are. Try visiting Caneel Bay and you will be duly impressed by their expansive gardens, grounds and beaches. If you want luxury, class and comfort, and if you can't find anything other than rack rate at the Westin, head straight to Caneel Bay where we stayed a couple of years back and found it to be head and shoulders above the Westin. The best beach to visit away from the crowds is Maho Bay.

After using this website extensively, this is my first posting. The Westin is a beautiful resort, with some of the most unique and gorgeous plants I've ever seen. Most were in full bloom as well. Many aren't native to St. John, but they are beautiful nonetheless. The food is way over-priced, and my wife and I couldn't justify paying those prices for long. So we asked around after dropping $80 a meal and found some great values. The Lime Inn is excellent. Yes, it does have plastic furniture and yes it is hot, but just about everywhere is hot, including the resort's flagship restaurant--Chloe and Bernard's. Make sure you get the fresh lobster at the Lime Inn. Also, make sure you eat at Uncle Joe's barbecue. Let me warn you, though. This place, like the best barbecue places on the U.S. mainland, is a hole. The food is excellent, though, and we spent less than $30 for two of us. It's located across the street from a Dominican-owned bar, with island music playing from it's juke box. We enjoyed the whole package, but it's not for everyone.
reviews.title: Beautiful Island

reviews.text: Back to the Westin--I do agree that the resort is expensive for what you get. The beach is really no beach at all, with all the boats docked within a stone's throw. The pool was very nice and not very crowded when we were there. And, yes--the Westin did just replace every single beach chaise lounge chair during our stay. I cannot believe the belly-aching of one of the recent posters on this site regarding the bugs on this island. These are the islands, "mon," and that's just part of it. The poster also made it seem that the bugs were in the room, and that's just completely false. Any beach in the Caribbean is susceptible to sand fleas and mosquitoes. Yes, I do have 10-15 bug bites on my body, as you should expect from a week in the tropics, but I can guarantee I won't be seeing my physician to help alleviate my itching.
reviews.title: Poor value
Pleasantly surpised skeptic! Memorial day weekend.
reviews.text: If you are a diver or you're just looking to get your certification during your trip, call Low Key watersports in Cruz Bay. They are much less expensive than the dive shop at the Westin. Ask for Bob, the owner, or Ellen, the operations manager. They and their staff were great.

One last bit of advice--You MUST get away from the Westin to truly appreciate where you are in the world and the beauty of the islands around you. Instead of going with the crowds on the group excursions with the watersports shop on site, visit with the Nauti Nymph guys. They too have a desk on site. We chartered a twin-hulled powerboat with two 250 HP 4-stroke engines for a full day, with a captain to act as a tour guide and to take care of everything. We had Nate, and he took great care of us. He let us tell him what we wanted out of the day trip and he recommended the best spots. We visited Leinster Bay, where we snorkeled for a half-hour. Then we went to Jost Van Dyke, BVI and then went to the Soggy Dollar Bar, where the "Painkiller" was invented. After that we went to the Caves on Norman Island for more snorkling and then it was lunch time. We at at Willy T's, a "pirate ship" anchored in one of the bays. It was one-half bar, one-half restaurant. The food was great and quite reasonable. After eating we went to the "Indians" for more snorkling and then headed back, arriving back at the Westin at 4:30. This was by far our best day of the trip. It was very expensive, especially since it was just my wife and myself carrying the full cost, but we figured we spent $5k on the trip so far, and what's another $700 for a dream date. The boats will hold up to 6 people, including the captain. If you have that many, then this trip is a steal. By the way my wife was 5 months pregnant the whole time, and Nate took great care of us.
reviews.title: Great Vacation
Avoid the Westin St. John
reviews.text: We experienced a couple significant problems with the Westin St. John and I would recommend finding another place to stay when visiting the Virgin Islands.

1. They applied many additional charges to our credit card that were not made. We were charged for: Phone calls made when we were out of the room, food purchases we did not make, mini bar charges we didn't make, tips that were not left on a credit card, additional charges for insurance from the attached watersports facitiliy, additional nights and taxes room charges, two of these charges were made in the month that followed after we left the resort. To us it is clear that this resort is stealing money from people who do not fight these charges - corruption is common in St. John.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort - Had a Great Time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. The foodservice staff at the pool have all their tips included in the purchases - normally not a big deal - however, the service here has clearly suffered. We witnessed waitresses eating french fries from someones plate on the way to their table, and they were generally not friendly.
reviews.title: OK for some families, but not for couples

reviews.text: 3. I wouldn't swim in the water at the beach at the Westin - even the locals say don't go in. There are ton's of boats that live in this bay and they dump their waste directly into the water creating a health hazard.
reviews.title: Dumb down your expectations...

reviews.text: Personally I would recommend renting a house in St. John, it probably won't cost more and there are many available.
reviews.title: Great Vacation

likes.disliked: — not all the rooms have good views of the bay

reviews.text: I stayed at the Westin St. John for one week with my husband. We had a pool view room which was newly upgraded and plenty of space. The resort itself is gorgeous. The grounds are lush and well maintained. The pool is a great size with plenty of places to lay out. The beach is okay. There are many more beaches on the island worth seeing compared to this one and it appears that is what a lot of people do.
reviews.title: A beautiful resort
Great Vacation !!!!!
reviews.text: We had a few issues with service, primarily maid service. Three days in a row, we didn't receive towels when the room was cleaned and one day we never got our wakeup call. Other than that, the hotel staff was friendly and accomodating.

We rented a car and brought it over on a barge from St. Thomas. We spent 3 days driving across the island. The views are breathtaking and the beaches are the best I've ever seen. I recommend Trunk, Salt Pond, Hawksnest and Cinnamon.
reviews.title: Great Time at the Westin

reviews.text: We went into town almost every night for dinner. We had lobster at Morgan Mango's, mexican at Margharita Phil's and seafood which was outstanding at Lime Inn. We also went to Stone Terrace and had a delicious meal seated right up by Cruz Bay.
reviews.title: Fun at the Westin

reviews.text: The resort has a lot of children. If that bothers you, I recommend you try another resort on the island, as I've never seen so many kids at one resort, but since we were gone at beaches half the time, it wasn't a big deal. You will completely enjoy a trip to this beautiful island.
reviews.title: Great Vacation

reviews.text: I need to start out by saying that I travel frequently and am a Starwood Preferred Gold member in addition to being AAdvantage Platinum and Hilton HHonors Gold. I have been completely happy with my stays at Westin hotels/ resorts over the past several years until my recent experience.
reviews.title: Bad experience at Westin St John

reviews.text: We had stayed at the Westin St John six years ago for our honeymoon and it had been a great experience. The experience this time around was completely different than before. We were not granted some basic requests for our stay and the overall treatment was the worst I have ever received at any of the Starwood properties.
reviews.title: Westin - Great for kids - Ouch for adults.

reviews.text: > Our request for a room with double beds was denied - we had one king bed for two adults and two kids
reviews.title: Westin was not what I expected but I loved St. John!

reviews.text: > Our request for a second or third floor room was denied
reviews.title: Loved our stay at the Westin!
Loved it, but very expensive!!!
reviews.text: > Our request to check in an hour earlier than 3pm was denied

Let me begin by saying that I have stayed at the Westin St. John over 10 times, so don't be quick to trust the reviews of hostile tourists who have had minor problems throughout their trip and decide to degrade the Westin out of mere rage. First, when planning a trip to the Caribbean understand that everything runs a little bit slower, no matter where you stay...
reviews.title: Westin vs. Caneel Bay

reviews.text: The Westin and Caneel Bay make up the 2 biggest resorts on St. John. Because of this there is alot of debate and competition between the two...even though I think the resorts would appeal to two completley different crowds.
reviews.title: A good base to explore St. John
Best Hotel Ever
reviews.text: -Caneel Bay is for those who litterally want a vacation away from their life: with no telephones or televisions in any of the rooms. Young children are looked down upon and there are even dining areas on through Caneel Bay with minimum age requirements, even if you are staying there. The pool is very ugly, and not close to the beach at all. This is a very quiet resort with mostly honeymooners and adults.

reviews.title: Stop...This is the only review you have to read!
reviews.text: -The Westin, on the other hand, has features that accomodate all age ranges (especially geared to children). Water trampolines line the waters of the beach. The pool is huge and beautiful. The grounds are green and lucious...with an on site deli, a resturant right next to the pool for lunch, a casual resturant for dinner, an upscale resturant, and 2 bars. There are also a few shops next to the deli.
Hope this helps...
reviews.title: Very Nice - not a 5 star

reviews.text: My family of three has traveled and stayed at the Westin three years consecutively. We have a pool villa for one week but usually extend our stay in the hotel section using points. There have been issues of some sort each year, some more important than others. We have always had them dealt with in a timely fashion. The staff has never been anything but helpful and responsive.
reviews.title: It's
we had a great time - except for the mosquitoes!
reviews.text: We discussed the issues we had regarding the villa at the owner services office. The villas are literally full for 51 weeks a year. Nobody would want maintenance done on their week. So they have only one week per year to work on them, and in rotation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This year we were a little concerned about our arrival as it was the day after Dean went south of the USVI. The staff at the airport was amazingly reassuring and accommodating. The hotel really went the extra mile to make us feel safe and comfortable on trip from St. Thomas. Our villa was ready on arrival, the luggage arrived with 30 minutes of check-in and the rum punch was cold. Each time we had our luggage (and our four guests' luggage) transferred, it was picked up and delivered within 30 minutes or so.
reviews.title: Cheese Wiz on the Nachos? What are they thinking?!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel room we were in post-villa was more than adequate. It was an end room so the ceilings were very high, the light and view were lovely. They have a green program for washing linens which we try to take advantage of. Water is a premium on the island. Each time we put towels out to be replaced, they were. The general cleanliness of the room was fine. The mini fridge was not re-filled, but we were not charged, and we don't drink Johnny Walker, so no biggie.
reviews.title: For the price, villas are a better option

likes.disliked: — Constant golf carts zooming by, crowded pool, loud guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds at this resort are so beautiful. The beach...so, so...pool is lovely but always busy. The bar and Snorkels are always good and the service is more than fine. They also have frequent service on the beach. The Beach Bar is not really a value. It is expensive and the food is only okay for any meal other than breakfast. We were disappointed with Chloe and Bernard's. It was far better before being turned into a steak house. You can do alot better for food in Cruz Bay. It's so easy with the cabs constantly going back and forth. Totally worth it.
reviews.title: Great time at a Great resort

likes.liked: — Cinnamon, and trunk the cool breeze off the ocean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in Feb, using hotel points. Don't get me wrong... you're in st. johns, how could you not have a good time. A few observations- you can check in for the resort right at the airport (+) and even book transportation to the hotel from the airport at the same time (+). Hotel shuttle/water taxi is very efficient however also in my opinion, expensive. Hotel grounds are very well maintained. Beach outside of hotel is nice as well. Pool had some cracks- looked a bit old and in need of freshening up. Our room was a standard room in the middle of the resort complex. Room had seen better days. Lamp didn't work; bathroom water would mysterious turn extremely hot or extremely cold. Sheets had what looked to be burn marks on them. Around the resort, it looked like the roof needed replacing. The resort is huge. It takes some time to walk from one spot to another. You can walk into Cruz Bay from the hotel, but be prepared to avoid traffic ... also there is a large hill. Food at hotel is expensive. Free coffee in the morning up until a certain time. After that, the coffee is $8? There is a grocery store near by. I suggest stocking up there for snacks and sodas. Hotel rooms have fridge. Ours did not keep things cold. One highlight- resort feeds iguanas daily. Truly something to see. Also, staff EXTREMELY friendly. You could not make it to the pool area without saying hi to at least 5 staff. I would like to go back, but can't afford the prices during the high season. $40 resort fee, included internet.
reviews.title: Nice beach, hotel is in need of renovations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband is a Platinum SPG member so we stayed free on points. I always judge a hotel by how they treat guests including guests staying on points. We were treated like royalty at the Westin St John. I read all of the reviews before our trip and I was worried before we arrived. We had a beautiful room on the first floor in building 12 with a patio that allowed you to walk directly on to the beach or walk to the bar/pool. This is not like a traditional Westin - no turndown service or twice daily housekeeping but you are at the beach so not necessary!! We had a great time at the hotel! The room was very comfortable and clean. We had an awesome time and would definitely go back! The staff was very friendly and helpful too!
reviews.title: Awesome time at the Westin!!

reviews.text: The Westin is an expensive, large, spread out resort with spotty transportation between areas. We had four villas and rooms and asked to be put close to each other. We were not close to each other or to the lobby. The beach area is full of seaweed and the pool area has large iguanas that invade your space. Very pleasant staff that just cannot seem to get it together to meet your needs. They smile and wave as they pass while you are waiting at a tram stop in the broiling sun. The amenities are tired and need replacing and / or cleaned. The food is expensive and average at best. We did really enjoy the wonderful smoothies at the pool bar area. Be aware that the lobby, restaurants and bar areas are open air. While the breeze is delightful, the birds, iguanas, and other animals are also present.
reviews.title: Don't stay at the Westin!

reviews.text: We are a family of 5 (2 adults and 3 kids-13, 8, and 5). We stayed here the last week in July. I have to say that I read tripadvisor (forums, reviews) every day for the past 6 months before we left for St. John. During that time, I found a wealth of information on St. John and the the Westin. I have to say that I agree that St. John is an absolutely beautiful place to visit. The Westin grounds are beautiful. We used the Westin ferry service to and from the hotel. It was a good choice for us since it was our first time there. We rented a villa from an owner. We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo in the Hillside Villas (#3319). I did like the unit. It had more than enough room for us. We had a great view. My kids liked swimming in the pool beside the unit. Everyone we encountered at the Westin was nice. They responded to every phone call we made to express services. (They had to come and spray for ants 3 times. We also used the service of the golf carts to get down to the pool a few times.) We rented a jeep. (We were so glad that we did.) Most of our days consisted of going to a beach for a few hours then returning to the Westin. We went to Caneel, Cinammon, Trunk Bay, and Maho. We ate lunches at the pool. My kids loved the pool. It was never really overly crowded, but did have a little trouble finding a chairs. (It would be nice if they had more.) I had read bad reviews about the beach. It really was fine except my kids hated all the seaweed. Once they got past the seaweed, they loved the inflatable rock climb and trampoline in the water. We went out to dinner each night. Ate at Cruize Bay Prime, Cafe Roma (our favorite), Banana Deck, Rhumb Lines, and Shipwreck Landing. We took a private charter with Palm Tree Charters and Captain John. This was a wonderful experience. I would highly recommend it!
reviews.title: First Time in St. John and The Westin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went into St. Thomas to Coral World and took a trip into Charlotte Amille to walk around and see the shops. I also have to mention that my two youngest girls went twice to the Kids Club. (There were only 1 or 2 other kids with them each time.) I was disappointed in the Kids Club. I did not like that I had to "make a reservation a day in advance" for my kids to go there. (Especially since I was on vacation and paying for the Kids Club.) We signed up to do a decorating cookie activity. Two other children from the pool heard that we were going and decided to walk over with us. The ladies at the activity actually told them that they could not attend because they hadn't signed up. (Give me a break-They could have had a little extra dough.) The one little girl was crying that she could not participate. My girls shared their dough with the girls so they could participate. Everyone loved the iguana feedings at 3:00. We actually went three times. My kids also enjoyed the movie nights at the pool on Sunday and Wednesday. All in all, it was a great trip. I would suggest doing your homework if you are going for the first time.
reviews.title: BEST PLACE I HAVE STAYED

reviews.text: I just returned from a five-day stay at the Westin on St. John for a combined conference and family vacation. Our previous experiences with Westin properties had been positive and were looking forward to our stay. The tone of previous reviews seems mixed and from our experience there, mixed is what you get.
reviews.title: Couldn't Wait to Leave
The pros & cons
reviews.text: Service. Let me first say that we are generally low-maintenance people as hotel guests; we check in and check out without many requests in between and generally go with the flow. When we arrived in the USVI our luggage didn't arrive with us. Flight-weary from our cross-country travel, we showed up at the Westin around noon hoping to check in early. They couldn't accommodate us at the time so we walked around the property in the meantime. We kept checking back with the front desk but they didn't seem to have much concern or the ability to muster up the resources to prepare a room for us. In fact they kept us hanging on for three hours until some time after their official 3:00 check-in time. The reception desk's response to our lost luggage was indifferent as well. They couldn't be bothered to call the Westin-operated kiosk at the airport in St. Thomas, nor did they offer us a phone so we could do it ourselves.

The remainder of our stay showed that that there are "can do" people on the staff mixed with the "can't/won't do". We spent an entire day with promises of luggage from American Airlines and the hotel, and eventually encountered two employees who seemed to be helpful. I don't know what their official titles were but one seemed to be in charge of the boat dock/ferry and another seemed to be overseeing the restaurant. We found the "can't do" people at the front desk (three requests over the course of a day to have a roll-away bed put in the room in addition the request made at the time of reservation) and the concierge desk (couldn't seem to be bothered with arranging an excursion to the British VI). Toward the end of our stay there was a guy operating the cash register at the convenience store who offered his help to improve our stay, but by that time we were done.
reviews.title: nice, not 5 stars

reviews.text: Westin Ferry and taxis vs. own transportation. We rented a car at the airport and brought it over on a ferry. The car was $200 for a week, $52 for the ferry and we spent $15 on gas. The cheapest car rental at the hotel was about $70 a day. My recommendation would be to use Westin's ferry if your flight plans allow it and either rent a car or use taxi's. The island is small and could easily be toured in one day. The taxis are open-air and present all over the island, including all the beaches.
reviews.title: not worth the $$$$$

reviews.text: Rooms. Ours was nice and very spacious. The Westin Heavenly Beds are great.
reviews.title: Had a Great Time

reviews.text: This past trip (August 18th through the 25th), marks our family's 7th visit to the Westin. We've been fortunate enough to have sampled several hotel rooms, 2 bedroom villas, and this time, one of the three bedroom villas.
reviews.title: Average Stay on A Superior Island

likes.liked: — The hotel is located in and around magnificant scenery.
likes.disliked: — Staff attitude leaves a lot to be desired.

reviews.text: We've also gone the public transportion route (the ferry at RedHook and the ferry behind Main Street in Charlotte Amalie), and the Westin's own transportion option.
reviews.title: Westin--people terrific, resort a little tired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the hotel has gone down hill, but it's still a nice place to stay, and the vacation well worth the trip.
reviews.title: OK - but probably won't stay there again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To start with, the people of the island, and by that, I mean those that live in or around St. John who are employed in the service industry, seem not to care that their financial existence depends on the tourist trade. They have become rude, complacent, and arrogant. This is not to say that you won't be able to find a freindly face in the sea of naysayers, but it seems as if these folks want nothing to do with those that they are employed to help. The help at the Westin typifies this. We were no longer greeted by smiles or a "good morning", but instead, were met with stares when we requested something as simple as pool towels. My husband actually asked one of the servers at the pool bar if she had a problem taking orders, and she was surprised that a guest was actually questionng her attitude. She became quite helpful after that.
reviews.title: Spectacular Westin Resort don't believe the nay sayers

likes.liked: — It provided my family and friends with the most spectacular scenery ever.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arriving on the island (by the Westin Ferry, which is well worth the money, and certainly beats any public transportation option, hands down), we were met with rum punch and a quick golf-cart trip to our villa. (Beware- those golf carts are everywhere, and it seems that you need to develop a handly little skill of avoiding them by jumping onto any grassy area when you see or hear them coming, and come they do. They are eveywhere and anywhere, and about as annoying as you can imagine).
reviews.title: Will definitely return!

reviews.text: After booking our vacation here with my husband to celebrate a "special"birthday, I became quite unnerved by the poor reviews on ths site. As time went on, it was even more confusing to try and get a handle on why there were SUCH mixed reviews, almost as though people were staying in two different places, one was moldy and dirty and the other was quite lovely??!! They only explanation that I can arrive at is that some rooms have clearly been renovated while others have not....but this is only my guess.
reviews.title: Westin Was Great For Us Dispite Conflicting Reviews
Westin St, John- Another great time!
reviews.text: In any case, OUR EXPERIENCE AT THE WESTON WAS GREAT!!!

We stayed in a Pool View Room (Bldg 14) and the room was very nice! It had what appeared to be a brand new bath room which was beautiful, complete w/ Heavenly Shower. The room decor was very attractive and the Heavenly Bed was great!!There was a nice size balcony w/ 2 chairs and a table.
reviews.title: St. John is lovely, Westin needs updating

reviews.text: Airport CheckIn - excellent!! Saved time, veru pleasant staff. Nice A/C waiting room provided while waiting for the taxi to head to the ferry. No need to go to a front desk once you arrive to the hotel!!
reviews.title: Mixed Stay @ the Westin St. John
Spend $5000 somewhere else
reviews.text: Westin Ferry -excellent! Cool cloths and free bottled water provided on board. Good value, because you can use the ferry back and forth to St Thomas all during your stay with free transportation into the shopping district.

Have to say that my family of 7 had a terrific time. We had rented a 3 bedroom pool villa #4315 from St John Condos (highly recommend) and it was great. Newly refurbished, the bedrooms were very spacious, all amenities you would need in a villa. We never once had an issue regarding getting a ride on a golf cart if we did not want to walk. They were buzzing around the hotel all the time and would ask if we wanted a ride instead of walking. Rented a pool cabana a few days and it was great. No looking for 7 chairs together and we had a place to keep our things. Kids were happy to watch the soccer games down by the main pool. Gave you a bucket of bear, suntan lotion, water, and Evian water mist. Took the car ferry over from Red Hook and was very easy. Saw a left had turn sign on red and had to think about that for a moment.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had eaten a few times at the beach cafe over near the water-sport desk and the food was terrific for all. Went to Rhumblines for dinner one evening and everyone was happy there also with the food. Sorry to say, we went to Spyglass for dinner on the 5th of July to eat and watch the fireworks and we had to wait 2 hours after our appetizers came out to receive our dinner. As you would expect no-one was that hungry after the wait.
reviews.title: Stay Somewhere Else

reviews.text: Went to Truck Bay and did a Snuba excursion. Tammy was terrific and had everyone comfortable with the scuba equipment before we descended under water. 30 minutes went by very fast. Did the Bad Kitty for a day excursion to The Baths, Cooper Island, Jost Van Dyke and snorkeling at Peter Island. Very quick boat and handles the water well. Did not get jostled around while running.
reviews.title: Fantastic; best vacation we've ever had!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: St. John is a beautiful island. The Westin St. John needs to really put some of the money they take from you in the “Resort Fee’s” and do some long overdue renovations. To begin with check in took entirely too long. There was only one person at the front desk and one person in line in front of me and I waited for almost thirty minutes to get checked in. As a platinum member, the person at the front desk told me that she had a really nice upgrade for me. We got to the room and found a 6x3 (foot) puddle waiting for us on the carpet that ran from the back door to the edge of the bed. I attempted to call the front-desk, I waited on hold for about 15 minutes, when I finally got through I moved away from the desk and the phone cut off because the cord was broken. I went to the front desk, I was told that they would have this cleaned. Several hours later, this hadn’t been done and they finally offered another room, but by this time it was after ten p.m. and I was exhausted from the trip and just decided to wait until the morning. The next morning when I went to look at my new room, I found it already occupied. The only other room they had available was on the ground floor, which if it rained may allow water into the room. Our so-called upgrade was a room with a view of the tennis courts in the front and some tree’s in the back. The room itself was in need of a fresh coat of paint and a deep cleaning. What really irritated me was when I got a phone call from the concierge offering us a tour of the villa’s available to “owners”. Can you say time share scam? Why would I want to take time out of my vacation to look at a nice room that you can’t make available to me when my room is inadequate? When I complained to the front desk, they offered no accommodations or refunds, or extra SPG points on my account. This hotel cost almost as much if not more than some of the villa’s on the island. My advice? Save your money and stay somewhere else
reviews.title: St. John is awesome, Westin needs to step up their game

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We traveled with another family, their college age kids, our adult kids and their friends (11 in all). Our ages range from 55 to 17. Even with the wide variety of ages and interests, every one of us had a great vacation. Of the many, many highlights, the Cabanas were amazing. We rented the cabanas for 2.5 days of our 6 day stay and they added an extra level of relaxation and enjoyment on top of the already great atmosphere at the Westin St. John. We utilized the spa - which was wonderful. Amanda and Emily worked with us and provided wonderful massages. David helped us out with some additional amenities in one of our rooms - he was 'Johnny on the spot'. Brittany and many others on the activities staff checked with our group frequently to ensure we had what we needed to enjoy ourselves. She did a great job and helped make our stay a tremendous success. The rooms were older, but well maintained, clean and appropriate to the minimal amount of time we spent sleeping in them. The location is unbelievably beautiful - from the entrance to the bay to the palm covered hills rising behind the resort. We did some research prior to arriving and scheduled activities ranging from a scuba 'orientation' dive to parasailing to a cruise to some of the nearby British Virgin Islands. We didn't think of it in advance, but while there, we rented cars to tour the island and check out many of the beaches. If you want to do this, get your car in advance because we had a hard time finding rental cars available on short notice. We quickly discovered that taxis (converted pick-up trucks) will take you almost anywhere on the island for $5 to $25 a person. Our cruise to the British VI was tremendous. If you come to Cruz Bay, you've got to see the 'Baths'. Our boat Captain, Justin and the First Mate, Carrie really made our trip enjoyable and since we were essentially a 'private' charter (we had the boat to ourselves) remained flexible with the schedule. The highlight was definately the 'Baths' though. We could have stayed there all day, but Justin and Carrie correctly advised us to see some other sights, snorkle and do some beachcombing as well. The only negative we can think back to was the rudeness of Kevin, who works in the Cruz Bay Watersports shop. Kevin provided good information, was responsive to our needs when scheduling activities, but his condescending attitude was a turn off. It sounds like our stay was busy, with constant activity and movement, but the staff, location and on-site amenities combined to make it the most relaxing vacation we've ever taken. We loved it!
reviews.title: Our third trip to St. John's was fabulous!
Terrible Service at an Incredible Price
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed one night at the Westin on May 19 before getting access to our condo, where we stayed for the rest of our St. John vacation.

reviews.title: Warning --Stay somewhere else
reviews.text: The grounds are beautiful at the Westin and there seems to be a lot to do. However, the service is poor at best. It took 4 hours for bags to get to our rooms. We called repeatedly and were told that it would only be 15 minutes more, so we waited. We asked if we could pick them up ourselves but were told that was impossible. There were no apologies made; two times, the staff promised to call back with an update so we could plan what to do with the rest of our day. They never called back.

reviews.title: Great place to stay
reviews.text: Food at the Beach Side cafe was abysmal, and $100 for two people. I hesitate to be too cutting - but I have had better food at truck stops.

We had hoped our one day stay would give us an opportunity to check out the resort so we could see if we would stay there in the future. Since we spent all afternoon waiting for luggage, we were not able.
reviews.title: Nothing but FUN at the Westin St.John!!

reviews.text: When you pay steep prices for a resort, the service should be excellent. Go elsewhere!
reviews.title: beautiful property, okay beach, fair service
A great value for SPG members
reviews.text: Stayed at the Westin from 2/9 - 2/14, and had an absolutely great time. Missed the big Northeast snowstorm, which made it even better. Listed below are a couple of tips/highlights. Note that we didn't have any children w/ us, so can't speak to that aspect of things:

reviews.title: Not Worth It
reviews.text: * While the Westin ferry is pricey ($75/pp), it definitely was worth it. Room assignments are actually made at the airport, at the Westin counter. If there's a line, have one person wait in line while the other(s) retrieves the luggage from the carousel. Once you have your luggage, you leave it at the Westin airport desk and, the next time you see it, it's in your room. Pack a bathing suit in a knapsack or some carry-on, as the luggage is generally off-loaded from the ferry about 1/2 hour after the passengers. The St. Thomas airport is not air-conditioned, so, while small, the Westin airport lounge has A/C and is comfortable. If it's going to be awhile until the next ferry, they'll bring you over to the dock, where there's a restaurant to grab a bite or drink. Adjacent to the dock restaurant is the last true grocery store you'll see for the remainder of your trip, so I would definitely suggest checking it out to pick up any items you can fit in your carry-on. You'll know when the ferry shows up, as it has a huge Westin logo on it.

* Taxis: You can go virtually anywhere on the island via the taxis which park in front of the lobby (and are everyone on the island). Rates are fixed per person, and I didn't get the feeling that they were expecting tips above and beyond the rate. The taxis are generally open-air pick-up truck customizations, with three or four rows. The drivers may try to wait around for some additional paying customers once you're on the taxi. If you wait more than a few minutes, insist that they just take whoever's in the taxi right then. We had to do this once or twice when returning from one of the beaches. * The Westin deli (Mango Deli), which is near the gym, is good for coffee, bagels, and danishes. It also has beer and wine for sale. The beer prices were OK, the wine prices were high. For wine, I would recommend the grocery store I previously mentioned on the St. Thomas dock. At the deli, you can borrow a small cooler for the day (with credit card deposit). This cooler is good for hitting the beaches.
reviews.title: Outstanding & Totally Relaxing

reviews.text: * Beaches - closest is Hawksnest, but everyone seems to skip that and go to Trunk Bay or Cinnamon (or beyond), which are both beautiful. As you're getting close to Trunk Bay, there's an overlook that is just amazing. This is the vantage point for virtually every Trunk Bay picture you've ever seen. Insist that the taxi driver stop there for a few minutes (at least) to check it out, and get a picture or two. If you don't ask, they'll probably just zip right by it. We went to Trunk Bay twice and to Cinnamon Bay once. The first time we went to Trunk (8:00 a.m.), we were the first ones there and actually didn't have to pay the usual park fee ($4/pp). The snorkel rental shop doesn't open until 9:00 a.m. No crowds at all at this time of day. The second time we went was in the afternoon, and it was much more crowded, and we were bumping into people all around the coral reef. Cinnamon Bay is larger and there are more options for water sports here (e.g. windsurfing). There's also a campground here, so there's always people around.
reviews.title: Great Place, Great People, Great Time....
Beautiful Place
reviews.text: * Snorkeling - The coral is so-so, but the fish are plentiful and colorful. At Trunk, some of the larger ones will swim very near you, in anticipation of getting a free hand-out. Not much quality snorkeling at the Westin beach, though.

This was the 4th time that my family has stayed at the Westin St. John. The previous 3 times we had a great experience, however we were so dissappointed because this past time was awful! Their management must be changing over, because we encountered WAY too many problems in the 5 days we were there. Since there were 8 of us traveling, we had 4 separate rooms. Each room had huge bleach stains all over the carpet. There were cockroaches in my parent's room, and also in the room of a couple staying a few doors down from me. There were also cockroaches crawling all over the beach bar, absolutely disgusting!!! Our minibar was full of half-eaten food leftover from the previous guest. We did not receive towels, washclothes, or maid service on a daily basis, and when we called to request these things, waited approx. an hour for someone to come (the resort is not that big - it should NOT take nearly that long). At breakfast one morning at the beach cafe, my fiance ordered eggs, which came out completely raw and cold. THe food and service is terrible - we waited an average of 30-45 minutes just to get our order taken every time we ate at the beach cafe. My parents had a big carpet nail sticking out of the carpet in their room, which my mother stepped on, puncturing her foot. The bartenders, waitresses, and other staff were extremely rude and had a lot of attitude, not what you want to deal with on vacation! When we complained to the management about all the problems, they responded with shrugs and blank stares. We will not be returning to the Westin next year. This resort used to be great, but I would not recommend staying here now. The quality of the Westin is 2 stars at best, which is outrageous, considering that it is listed as a 4-5 star hotel (and the pricetag is certainly that of a 5 star hotel!)
reviews.title: DO NOT STAY HERE!

likes.disliked: — Service, food, room cleanliness, very overpriced for the quality

reviews.text: On the positive side, the pool is great and always clean. That is about the only plus to staying here.
reviews.title: Westin Disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Westin started out well enough. I checked-in early to drop off luggage and the front desk was kind, offering bottled water and taking care of the luggage quickly. When I returned to get my room assignment there were two other irate guests at the desk. Little did I know I would join them.
reviews.title: Love St John, Westin was great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rate I got through Priceline was good for the Westin, but more than I paid per night to stay at the Secret Harbor resort on St. Thomas for 10 days prior in our vacation. We figured the Westin would be an upscale treat to wrap up the vacation. However, at the end, even our kids preferred Secret Harbor with all the things the Westin does offer for kids. As avid snorkelers and beach lovers we thought we couldn't beat the convenience of actually staying on St. John - wrong.
reviews.title: St. John's 'Modern Luxury' Option

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having kids who prefer baths we asked for a tub stopper before leaving for the beach our 2nd day. After spending a day beach hopping we came back to find that the tile had been ripped out around the tub, there were no faucets or handles and no water in the room. There was a note that maintenance was working on the tub (you think?) and to call them. The front desk didn't listen to what I was saying and after 1 hr sent a maintenance person to check on our plumbing problem. He was appalled and called them to get me another room. After another hour we were bounced between room assignments and ended up with the room next door and told to use that bathroom.
reviews.title: Honeymoon at Westin in St John

aka: Westin St. John Resort & Villas Hotel Cruz Bay
description: Located on 1,200 feet of private beach The Westin Resort St. John, USVI is a tropical retreat that's easy to reach.
